title: Goldman Sachs | Associate | Bengaluru
content:
Education: B.Tech (IT) from a tier-3 college
Years of Experience: 3
Prior Experience: DevOps Engineer in a product based company
Date of the Offer: February 2025
Company: Goldman Sachs
Title/Level: Associate
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: 32 LPA base salary
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 3L signing bonus
Stock bonus: 0
Bonus: Performance based bonus on some percentage of base salary (10-20%, from what I've heard)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 35 LPA
Benefits: Standard Goldman Sachs benefits including health insurance, etc.

Is the offer lowballed for a person with 3 years of experience? Can I ask for more?

title: Servicenow | IC3 | Hyderabad
content:
Education:
Years of Experience:6 YOE

Salary: 40LPA
Relocation/Signing Bonus:0
Stock bonus:10k $ per year
Bonus: 4 LPA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 51LPA
Benefits:Standard
Other details:had a another offer from startup with similar package and more base.

Is it worth relocating for this package to hyd as i am based out of bangalore?  How is general tech stack and wlb in service now?

title: Target India | L5 | Bengaluru
content:
Education: Btech (CSE) 
Years of Experience: 5.5
Prior Experience: Leading FINTECH firm

Current CTC : 26.4 LPA ( All fixed )
Date of the Offer: 11 Feb 
Company: Target
Title/Level: Senior Engineer
Location: Bengaluru
Salary: 37 LPA Fixed
Relocation: Relocation(flights + accomodation)
Sign On : NA
Stock bonus: NA
Variable : 10 %
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 40.7 LPA

When I asked HR about the joining bonus, she mentioned that it's only available for immediate joiners. Also, if I present counteroffers, do they typically negotiate?

title: OpenText | Senior Software Engineer | 5.5 YOE | Bengaluru
content:
Education: MCA

Also how is WLB there.
